page.title: 19DWELLING IN LOWESWATER
page.content: There are 45 dwellings in the grid section: 29 cottages & houses, 11 agricultural holdings, 1 hotel, 1 inn, 1 guest house, a cartakers flat over the Village Hall & the Vicarage. All are constructed outwardly of local stone with slate roofs. 4 houses built in the last 50 years, 9 Victorian & 6 adaptions of existing buildings. Most other properties date from the 17 C. with few alterations. Special architectural features are mullioned windows, Oak lintels & stone staircases. Beck House & Crabtree have traditional Lakeland porches with stone sconces. Most farmsteads have been built in courtyard formation, some containing old arched doorways, probably carthouses. Arched entrances to Foulsyke & High Cross are dated, as are many houses at Lanthwaite cottage.
